We do this by doing only what is essential.

The difference between the way of the Essentialist and the Nonessentialist can be seen in the figure opposite.

In both images, the same amount of effort is exerted.

In the image on the left, the energy is divided into many different activities.

The result is that we have the unfulfilling experience of making a millimeter of progress in a million directions.

In the image on the right, the energy is given to fewer activities.
